hints_latex: Consider what adding vectors means component-wise.
hints_raw: Consider what adding vectors means component-wise.
question: A 01
sols_html:
To add vectors, we add component wise. Therefore,

\[\begin{aligned} &\mathbf{x}+\mathbf{y}\\ &=[0,-3,2]+[1,1,1]\\ &=[0+1,-3+1,2+1]\\ &=[1,-2,3]\end{aligned}\]

and so \(\mathbf{x}+\mathbf{y}=[1,-2,3]\).
sols_latex:
To add vectors, we add component wise. Therefore,\begin{align*}
&\mathbf{x}+\mathbf{y}\\
&=[0,-3,2]+[1,1,1]\\
&=[0+1,-3+1,2+1]\\
&=[1,-2,3]
\end{align*}
 and so $\mathbf{x}+\mathbf{y}=[1,-2,3]$.
sols_raw:
To add vectors, we add component wise.  Therefore,
<br />
<math>
\begin{align}
&\mathbf{x}+\mathbf{y}\\
&=[0,-3,2]+[1,1,1]\\
&=[0+1,-3+1,2+1]\\
&=[1,-2,3]\\
\end{align}
</math>
<br />

and so <math> \mathbf{x}+\mathbf{y}=[1,-2,3] </math>.
